thread.title: Fed's Tarullo Says He Doesn't Currently Back a 2015 Rate Rise
thread.title_full: Fed's Tarullo Says He Doesn't Currently Back a 2015 Rate Rise - Bloomberg Business

author: Bloomberg.com
title: Fed's Tarullo Says He Doesn't Currently Back a 2015 Rate Rise
text:
Federal Reserve Governor Daniel Tarullo said he doesn’t currently favor raising interest rates in 2015, breaking ranks with Chair Janet Yellen, who has said she expects the first increase since 2006 to be warranted by year-end.
“Right now, my expectation is, given where I think the economy would go, I wouldn’t expect it would be appropriate to raise rates,” he told CNBC in an interview Tuesday. “I want to hasten to add that that is an outlook that changes based on developments in the economy.”
Fed officials last month opted to delay a rate rise to wait for more information about how slowing growth in China impacts the U.S. outlook. Economic projections prepared for the meeting show that 13 of 17 of the central bankers saw a rate rise as appropriate this year.
His remarks follow cautious comments on Monday from fellow Governor Lael Brainard that the central bank take a wait-and-see approach to liftoff that contrasted with the views voiced recently by other officials, including Fed Vice Chairman Stanley Fischer and New York Fed President William C. Dudley, that liftoff was still appropriate if the economy grows as expected.
